result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

superMiscConds.notes: See Count 1 for Extended Supervision conditions

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript  PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING (51 pages) commencing JUNE 4, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Charles Adams in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant Charles Adams in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3:
  Defendant  advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED and READ IN.
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Lynette A., Charles M., and Gilbert B.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 3, credit for 90 days.
AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 1, credit for 90 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/4/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/4/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-6 month drivers license suspension as to COUNT 3 only
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Defendant's Motion to Withdraw Speedy Trial Demand, received and filed. sab
Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-04-2014 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 06-18-2014 at 9:00 a.m.
Speedy trial demand entered by defense counsel.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 15.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin present in court.  Defendant Charles Adams not in court, in custody.  Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court will amend bail.

Motion to Modify Bail received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Charles Adams in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Charles Adams in custody.  Marissa Santiago for Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.   Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Charles Adams in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Charles Adams in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
